subject: Re: [junit]  Ant task. where to place context.xml file?
msgSnippet: ... Tell your tests where the root directory is through a JVM property. Use that information in your test to locate context.xml. -- J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
vichandoko wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I am writing some test classes and using <junit> Ant to run a batch
> test. Within my test class, i need to reference to a context.xml
> file. Any idea where should it put the context.xml file? i've placed
> it at the root. but the test class could not locate it. However, when
> i packaged the same directory and run as a cactus test, it works.
>
> Any idea what should i do?

Tell your tests where the "root directory" is through a JVM property.
Use that information in your test to locate context.xml.
--
